    #!/usr/bin/env python3
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
"""
| @purpose: Default settings for processing.py   
| @date: Created on Sat May 1 15:12:38 2019
| @author: Semeon Risom
| @email: semeon.risom@gmail.com
| @url: https://semeon.io/d/R33-analysis
"""

#include local library in path
import os, re, inspect
import numpy as np
from datetime import datetime
from distutils.version import StrictVersion
import importlib, pkg_resources, pip, platform


    [docs]def stn(source):
    """
    Convert to scientific notation.

    Attributes
    ----------
    flt : :class:`float`
        Original number.

    Returns
    ----------
    output : :class:`str`
        Number in scientific notation, if (number < 0.0001) or (if number > 9999).
    """
    #convert to float
    source = float(source)
    
    #if less than 0.0001, use scientific notation
    if (source < 0.0001):
        output = '%.2E'%source
    #else if greater than 9999, use scientific notation
    elif (source > 9999):
        output = '%.2E'%source
    #else round number to 4th digit
    else:
        output = '%s'%(round(source, 4))
        
    return output
    


    [docs]def library():
    """Check if required libraries are available."""
    print(console['green'] + 'settings.library()' + console['ENDC'])
    
    #----for timestamp
    _t0 = datetime.now()
    _f = debug(message='t', source="timestamp")

    #check libraries for missing
    
    #list of possibly missing packages to install
    required = ['numpy','scipy','pandas','datetime','rpy2','pytz','seaborn','matplotlib','bokeh', 'nslr_hmm','PyGraphviz']
    
    #for geting os variables
    if platform.system() == "Windows":
        required.append('win32api')
    elif platform.system() =='Darwin':
        required.append('pyobjc')
    
    #try installing and/or importing packages
    try:
        #if pip >= 10.01
        pip_ = pkg_resources.get_distribution("pip").version
        if StrictVersion(pip_) > StrictVersion('10.0.0'):
            from pip._internal import main as _main
            #for required packages check if package exists on device
            for package in required:
                #if missing, install
                if importlib.util.find_spec(package) is None:
                    _main(['install',package])
                    
        #else pip < 10.01          
        else:
            #for required packages check if package exists on device
            for package in required:
                #if missing
                if importlib.util.find_spec(package) is None:
                    pip.main(['install',package])
            
    except Exception as e:
        return e
        #----finished
        print(console['blue']+'%s finished in %s msec'%(_f,((datetime.now()-_t0).total_seconds()*1000))+console['ENDC'])
    


    [docs]def debug(message, source='debug'):
    """
    Get function or class for console print.

    Attributes
    ----------
    message : :class:`str`
        Log message.
    source : :class:`str`
        Origin of call. Either debug or timestamp.
    
    """
    if source=='debug':
        caller = inspect.getframeinfo(inspect.stack()[1][0])
        event = "%s, line %d, in processing.%s(), %s" % (caller.filename, caller.lineno, caller.function, message)
        print(event)
    elif source=='timestamp':
        caller = inspect.getframeinfo(inspect.stack()[1][0])
        event = "processing.%s()" % (caller.function)
    
    return event
    


    [docs]def definitions(config):
    """
    Store definitions.

    Attributes
    ----------
    message : :class:`str`
        Log message.
    source : :class:`str`
        Origin of call. Either debug or timestamp.

    Returns
    -------
    config : :class:`dict`
        Returned dictionary
    
    """
    #----exclude
    pct_exclude = (round(config['subjects']['exclude']/config['subjects']['eyetracking'], 4)*100)
    config['def']['exclude'] = "To reduce the influence of outliers, %s (%.1f%%) participants were excluded due to \
    'Dotloc' or 'Stimulus Onset Errors' 3 SD above the median."%(config['subjects']['exclude'], pct_exclude)
    
    #----names
    config['def']['cesd_group'] = "a binary measure of CESD score (between subjects; 'Low' (&lt16) and 'High' (≥16))"
    
    #---citations
    # iaps
    text = 'International Affective Picture System (IAPS)'
    title = 'International Affective Picture System (IAPS)'
    reference = 'Lang, P., Bradley, M., Cuthbert, B. (2008). International affective picture system (IAPS): Affective \
    ratings of pictures and instruction manual. Technical Report A-8. University of Florida, Gainesville, FL.'
    config['def']['iaps'] = \
    "<a tabindex='0' class='popover-anchor' link-id='iaps' data-toggle='popover' data-content='%s' title='%s'>%s</a>\
    "%(reference, title, text)
    # pofa
    text = 'Pictures of Facial Affect (POFA)'
    title = 'Pictures of Facial Affect (POFA)'
    reference = 'Ekman, P., Friesen, W., (1976). Pictures of facial affect. Consulting Psychologist Press, Palo Alto.'
    config['def']['pofa'] = \
    "<a tabindex='0' class='popover-anchor' link-id='pofa' data-toggle='popover' data-content='%s' title='%s'>%s</a>\
    "%(reference, title, text)
    #lmer
    text = 'Bates, Mächler, Bolker, & Walker, 2015'
    title = 'Fitting Linear Mixed-Effects Models Using lme4'
    reference = 'Bates, D., Mächler, M., Bolker, B., & Walker, S. (2015). Fitting linear mixed-effects models using lme4. 2015, 67(1), \
    48.<br>doi: <a class="anchor" href="https://doi.org/10.18637/jss.v067.i01">https://doi.org/10.18637/jss.v067.i01</a>'
    config['def']['lmer'] = \
    "<a tabindex='0' class='popover-anchor' link-id='lmer' data-toggle='popover' data-content='%s' title='%s'>%s</a>\
    "%(reference, title, text)
    #glmer
    text = 'Bates, Mächler, Bolker, & Walker, 2015'
    title = 'Fitting Linear Mixed-Effects Models Using lme4'
    reference = 'Bates, D., Mächler, M., Bolker, B., & Walker, S. (2015). Fitting linear mixed-effects models using lme4. 2015, 67(1), \
    48.<br>doi: <a class="anchor" href="https://doi.org/10.18637/jss.v067.i01">https://doi.org/10.18637/jss.v067.i01</a>'
    config['def']['glmer'] = \
    "<a tabindex='0' class='popover-anchor' link-id='glmer' data-toggle='popover' data-content='%s' title='%s'>%s</a>\
    "%(reference, title, text)
    #anova
    text = 'Chambers, Hastie, 1992'
    title = 'Statistical Models in S'
    reference = 'Chambers, J., Hastie, T. (1992). Statistical Models in S. Wadsworth & Brooks/Cole.'
    config['def']['anova'] = \
    "<a tabindex='0' class='popover-anchor' link-id='anova' data-toggle='popover' data-content='%s' title='%s'>%s</a>\
    "%(reference, title, text)
    
	#----assumptions
	# normal distribution
    config['def']['nd'] = "Normal distribution: Samples are drawn from a normally distributed population."
	##Homogeneity of variance
    config['def']['hv'] = "Homogeneity of variance: Amount of variance for a IV is constant across the sample."
	# independent observations
    config['def']['io'] = "Independent observations: Samples have been drawn independently of each other."
	# Estimated Marginal Means
    config['def']['emm'] = "The 'Estimated Marginal Means' table provides a list pairwise comparisons for each level and factor \
    in our model (<a class='anchor' href='https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/emmeans/vignettes/comparisons.html'>emmeans package, \
    Version 1.3.2</a>)."
	# residuals vs fitted
    config['def']['rvf'] = "The Residuals vs Fitted plot is used to identify residual distribution. \
    If residuals are following a visible trend on the graph, then the homogeneity assumption was violated."
	# qq
    config['def']['qq'] = "The Normal Q-Q plot compares the standardized residuals against the theoretical quantiles from \
    a standard normal distribution. If the model residuals are normally distributed, then the points \
    on this graph will be plotted in a generally straight line."
    
    #----calibration, validation
    config['def']['calibration'] = "Symbols: square = mouse click, circle = calibration point, cross = gaze coordinates.<br>\
    To use the interactive plot, drag the mouse along the calibration point chart. Each pair of dots repersents gaze coordinates \
    recorded during the presentation of one of the calibration points."
    config['def']['validation'] = "Symbols: circle = calibration point, cross = gaze coordinates.<br>\
    To use the interactive plot, drag the mouse along the calibration point chart. Each pair of dots repersents gaze coordinates \
    recorded during the presentation of one of the calibration points."
    
    #----remove whitespaces
    for key, value in config['def'].items():
        config['def'][key] = re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', value).strip()
    
    return config
    

"""
Printable console.
"""
console = dict(
    black = '\33[40m',
    red =  '\33[41m',
    green =  '\33[42m',
    orange = '\33[43m',
    purple = '\33[45m',
    blue =  '\33[46m',
    grey =  '\33[47m',
    ENDC = '\033[0m')
    
"""
Metadata to store.
"""
metadata = dict(
    subject = None,
    session = None,
    filters = None,
    monitor_estimated = None,
    lum = None,
    start_time = None,
    end_time = None,
    os = None,
    gpu = None,
    browser = None,
    isWebcamUsed = None,
    WebcamDevice = None
)

"""
classify parameters
    v_th : :obj:`str`
        Velocity threshold in px/sec (ivt; default 20)
    dr_th : :obj:`str`
       Fixation duration threshold in px/msec (idt; default 100)
    di_th : :obj:`str`
        Dispersion threshold in px (idt; default 20)
    missing : :obj:`str`
       value to be used for missing data (simple)
    maxdist : :obj:`str`
       maximal inter sample distance in pixels (simple)
    mindur : :obj:`str`
       minimal duration of a fixation in milliseconds; detected fixation
       cadidates will be disregarded if they are below this duration  (simple)
"""
config={
    #!!!--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------articles, notes
    'articles':[
        'One algorithm to rule them all? An evaluation and discussion of ten eye movement event-detection algorithms',
        'Comparison of eye movement filters used in HCI'
    ],
    'sources':{
        'hmm': 'A new and general approach to signal denoising and eye movement classification based on segmented linear regression',
        'preprocessing': 'Detection of Saccades and Postsaccadic Oscillations in the Presence of Smooth Pursuit'
    },
    #!!!--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------file location
    'root': os.path.abspath(__file__+ '../../../'),
    'rpath': os.path.abspath(__file__+ '../../../../'),
    'output': os.path.abspath(__file__+ '../../../../output'),
    'processed': os.path.abspath(__file__+ '../../../../output/process/'),
    'summary': os.path.abspath(__file__+ '../../gRT-dotprobe-js.csv'), 
    #!!!--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------equipment metadata
    'events': {'fixation':1500,'stimulus':{'iaps':4500,'pofa':3000}},
    'redcap': {'token':'D04484634409375EA8CC34F5B71BC14A'},
    'monitor.cm': [52, 29.5], #screensize (cm)
    'resolution.px': [1920, 1080], #screensize (px)
    'lab_monitor_device': 'Dell UltraSharp U2414H',
    'eyelink_webcam': 'Eyelink 1000 Plus',
    'lab_monitor_device': 'Dell UltraSharp U2414H',
    'lab_webcam': 'Logitech C922 Pro Stream Webcam',
    'level': 'session',
    'distance': 615.0, #distance from screen (mm)
    #!!!--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------multiprocessing
    'cores': 7, #number of cpu cores to use for multiprocessing (all subjects only)
    #------------------------definitions
    'subjects': {},
    'def': {},
    'is': {},
    #------------------------subject metadata
    'source': 'webgazer', #is the data from eyelink or webgazer
    'subject': None,
    'session': 0,
    'trial': None,
    'location': 'home',
    #------------------------trial
    'single_trial': False,
    'single_subject': False,
    #!!!--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------pre-processing
    #1) remove missing data
    'remove_missing': False,
    #2) remove samples out of bounds (i.e. gx=(2255, -322)
    'remove_bounds': False,
    #3) remove one-sample spikes
    'remove_spikes': False,
    'spike_delta': 50,
    #!!!--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------filtering parameters
    'f_b':{'N':2,'Wn':0.2,'btype':'low'},
    'f_g':{'sigma':2},
    'f_m':{'size':5},
    'f_sg':{'window':11,'order':3}, #default window=11,order=3
    'f_a':{'weights':(np.asarray([1.,2.,3.,2.,1.]))},
    #!!!--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------classifcation parameters
    #should we classify when processing eyelink or webgazer 
    #note: always keep classify: True
    'classify': True,
    #if data is from eyelink, so we self classify fixations (True) or use original (False)
    'classify_eyelink_data': True,
    #if self classifying fixations, what classification technique should we use
    'ctype': 'hmm', #either hmm, simple, ivt, or idt
    #simple parameters
    'missing': 0.0, #value to be used for missing data (simple)
    'maxdist': 360, #maximal inter sample distance in pixels (simple)
    'mindur': 200, #minimal duration of a fixation in milliseconds
    #ivt parameters
    'v_th': 5, #Velocity threshold in px/sec (ivt; default 20)
    #idt parameters
    'dr_th': 50, #Fixation duration threshold in px/msec (idt; default 100)
    'di_th': 60, #Dispersion threshold in px (idt; default 20)
    'filters':[['SavitzkyGolay','sg']],
    #!!!--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------saving
    #save all participant metadata
    'all_metadata': False,
    #save participant metadata
    'metadata': False,
    #save participant data
    'save_data': True,
    #save plots
    'save_plot': False,
}
